hint.text: Remember : The rim of the hemisphere is also to be painted.

solution.text:
Inner radius of hemisphere,\(r_1=_{{k/Decimal(2)}}_\)m
Outer radius of hemisphere,\(=_{{(k/Decimal(2))+(j/Decimal(10))}}_\)m
Outer curved surface area of the hemisphere\(=_{{trunc((2*pi_val*((k/Decimal(2))+(j/Decimal(10)))**2),3)}}_m^2\)
Inner curved surface area of the hemisphere\(=2\pi r_1^2\)
\(=2\pi \times _{{k/Decimal(2)}}_^2\)
\(=_{{trunc((2*pi_val*(k/Decimal(2))**2),3)}}_m^2\)
Area of rim\(=\pi(r_2^2-r_1^2)\)
\(=\pi (_{{(k/Decimal(2))+(j/Decimal(10))}}_^2-_{{k/Decimal(2)}}_^2)\)
\(=_{{trunc((pi_val*(((k/Decimal(2))+(j/Decimal(10)))**2-(k/Decimal(2))**2)),3)}}_m^2\)
Total area to be painted\(=\)outer curved surface area \(+\) inner curved surface area \(+\) area of rim
\(=_{{trunc((2*pi_val*((k/Decimal(2))+(j/Decimal(10)))**2),3)}}_+_{{trunc((2*pi_val*(k/Decimal(2))**2),3)}}_+_{{trunc((pi_val*(((k/Decimal(2))+(j/Decimal(10)))**2-(k/Decimal(2))**2)),3)}}_\)
\(=_{{trunc(((2*pi_val*((k/Decimal(2))+(j/Decimal(10)))**2)+(2*pi_val*(k/Decimal(2))**2)+(pi_val*(((k/Decimal(2))+(j/Decimal(10)))**2-(k/Decimal(2))**2))),3)}}_\)
Therefore, total cost of painting \(=\) total area \(\times\) rate of painting
\(=_{{trunc(((2*pi_val*((k/Decimal(2))+(j/Decimal(10)))**2)+(2*pi_val*(k/Decimal(2))**2)+(pi_val*(((k/Decimal(2))+(j/Decimal(10)))**2-(k/Decimal(2))**2))),3)}}_ \times 25\)
\(=\)Rs.\(_{{trunc(25*((2*pi_val*((k/Decimal(2))+(j/Decimal(10)))**2)+(2*pi_val*(k/Decimal(2))**2)+(pi_val*(((k/Decimal(2))+(j/Decimal(10)))**2-(k/Decimal(2))**2))),3)}}_\)

content.text: Find the cost of painting all the surface, if the cost of painting is Rs.\(25\) per sq.m.
